(doc:webhooks) are HTTP or HTTPS calls sent from PagerDuty to your web server on the IP and port of your choosing. The current list of IPs that our webhooks are sent from can be obtained via a HTTPS GET request to the following URL:
The response will be a JSON-encoded list of IP addresses.
Updating ACLs to Account for Changes
If you are hardcoding IPs into your firewall, you can use a
when the A records for these hostnames change, or perform lookups on the aforementioned hostnames regularly to update your configurations.
If the firewall in question is an EC2 security group,
and Python 2.7 or later to run), given an IAM secret key with adequate permissions, can automatically update the security group with the necessary IP addresses to grant access.
If you are using the new Jira extension, you will also need to add the address records of
to any sort of safelist that controls network egress traffic; this integration makes special API calls that go through that particular hostname.
